item.title: Autoencoder and Variational Autoencoder Image Reconstruction
item.description:
A project employed Autoencoder (AE) and Variational Autoencoder (VAE) trained on the CelebA-HQ dataset.

  • Successfully implemented AE model to reconstruct input images, achieving close resemblance to the original
  • Employed VAE model that learned a probability distribution over the data, enabling a flexible and probabilistic approach to encoding and reconstruction
  • Showcased proficiency in training and utilizing AE and VAE models, gaining practical experience in machine learning and visual computing tasks

item.title: Object Detection and Localization for Pick and Place
item.description:
I am a member of a three-person team that conducted this project in spring 2023. The objective of this project is to perform pick and place tasks in Gazebo, using MoveIt! to move the robot and PCL to detect object positions and colours.

  • Created a simulated environment using ROS and Gazebo
  • Integrated MoveIt! to enable precise robot movements for pick and place tasks
  • Utilized PCL for object detection and localization
  • Focused specifically on identifying ’nought’ and ’cross’ shapes while excluding black obstacles
  • Implemented object counting functionality, excluding black obstacles

item.title: Structural-Functional Connectomes Relationship Modeling in the Brain
item.description:
A project aimed to modelling and investigating complete pattern of interconnections in the brain.

  • Explored the graph properties of connectomes
  • Determined how they are affected by certain parameters
  • Investigated structural-functional connectomes relationship by predicting direct and indirect weights
  • Authored a scientific report with a comprehensive analysis of the research
  • Delivered a professional presentation
